attributes.text:
<div ng-repeat="obj in targets">
  <twx-dt-target id="{{obj.id}}" x="0" y="0" z="0" rx="0" ry="0" rz="0" src="{{obj.src}}" istracked="false" stationary="true"></twx-dt-target>
<div>

<script name="shaded" type="x-shader/x-fragment">
  precision mediump float;
  const float PI=3.1415926; 
  varying vec3 vertex;
  varying vec3 normal;
  varying vec2 texcoord;
  varying vec4 vcolor;
			  
  uniform sampler2D tex0;
  uniform vec4 surfaceColor;
  uniform float pulse;
  uniform float tick;

  const vec4 ambientColor = vec4(0.15, 0.15, 0.15, 1.0); 
  const vec4 specColor    = vec4(0.05, 0.05, 0.05, 1.0); // almost matte
  void main() {
    vec4 color = vec4(1.,.5,.25,1.); // orange 
				 
    vec3 lightPos = vec3(1.,1.,1.);
    vec3 lightDir = -normalize(lightPos);
    vec3 finalNormal = normalize(normal);
				
    float lambertian = dot(lightDir,finalNormal);
    float specular = 0.0;
    vec3 viewDir = normalize(-vertex);

    if (lambertian < 0.0) 
        finalNormal = - finalNormal;

	vec3 reflectDir = reflect(-lightDir, finalNormal);
	float specAngle = max(dot(reflectDir, viewDir), 0.0);
	specular = pow(specAngle, 4.0);

    color = ambientColor * color +	
                   color * abs(lambertian)   +   
		      specColor * specular;
			
    float ts = (1. + sin(mod(tick,2.*PI))) * 0.5;		
    color.a = ts;	
    gl_FragColor=vec4(color);
  }
</script>
<script name="shaded" type="x-shader/x-vertex">
  attribute vec3 vertexPosition;
  attribute vec3 vertexNormal;
  attribute vec2 vertexTexCoord;
			
  varying vec2 texcoord;
  varying vec3 normal;  
  varying vec3 vertex;
  
  uniform mat4 modelViewProjectionMatrix;
  uniform mat4 normalMatrix;

  void main() {
    vec4 vp = vec4(vertexPosition, 1.0);
    gl_Position = modelViewProjectionMatrix * vp;
    normal      = vec3(normalize(normalMatrix * vec4(vertexNormal,0.0)));
    texcoord   = vertexTexCoord;
    vertex       = vp.xyz;
  }
</script>
<script name="pulse2" type="x-shader/x-vertex">
      attribute vec4 vertexPosition;
      attribute vec4 vertexNormal;

      varying vec3 I;
      varying vec3 N;
      varying vec3 Y;

      uniform mat4 modelViewProjectionMatrix;
      uniform mat4 modelViewMatrix;
      uniform mat4 modelMatrix;

      void main() {
        vec4 P       = modelViewMatrix * vertexPosition;
        I                = P.xyz - vec3(0.);
        Y               = vec3(modelMatrix * vertexPosition) ;
        vec4 n       = vec4(vertexNormal.xyz, 0.0);
        vec4 nn     = modelViewMatrix * n;
        N               = nn.xyz;
        gl_Position = modelViewProjectionMatrix * vertexPosition;
      }

</script>
<script name="pulse2" type="x-shader/x-fragment">
      precision mediump float; 

      varying vec3 I;
      varying vec3 N;
      varying vec3 Y;

      uniform float tick;
      float edgeFalloff = 1.0;
      float intensity = 1.0;
      float ambient = 0.8;
      uniform float pulse;
      uniform float vmy;
      uniform float vdy;
      void main() {
          // hardcoded yellow - we could make this a parameter
          vec4 color     = vec4(1.,1.,0.,0.);

          float opacity  = abs(dot(normalize(-N), normalize(-I)));
          opacity        = ambient + intensity*(1.0-pow(opacity,edgeFalloff));

          // the effect here is to sweep a sine wave over the xray, altering the
          // intensity (by modulating the transparency) as the sine wave
          // progresses
          float mt = mod(tick, 3.14156);
          float st  = sin(mt);
          float ppy = ((Y.y - vmy) / vdy) - 0.5;
          float ct = sin(mt + 3.1415 * ppy );
          float alpha = ct ;

          gl_FragColor   = opacity * color;
          gl_FragColor.a = 0.8 * clamp(st * alpha, 0., 1.);
      }

</script>
